name: trestle
content:

a supporting structure for a table, consisting of a flat piece of wood supported at each end by two pairs of sloping legs
slav-/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
engineering
  specialized a set of sloping supports holding a horizontal structure, used especially for railway bridges

a set of sloping supports holding a horizontal structure, used esp. for railroad bridges, or a bridge supported in this way: The train was crossing a trestle above a river near Baltimore.
